commands.speaker: Announcer
commands.line: And now for the weather. The large scale typhoon is expected to pass through the Kanto region between today and tomorrow...

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: (The wind outside is crazy. The sky is so dark, too. What's going to happen to the festival today?)

commands.speaker: Chika
commands.line: Oh, you're awake!

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Hey Chika. What's going on today?

commands.speaker: Chika
commands.line: I just heard from Mari that the Festival Committee contacted her. They said...

commands.speaker: Chika
commands.line: Good morning everyone!

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Morning.

commands.speaker: Mari
commands.line: Good morning! Were you okay getting here? The crazy wind didn't blow you away, did it?

commands.speaker: Dia
commands.line: They wouldn't be here if it did.

commands.speaker: Kanan
commands.line: Yeah, exactly.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Kanan and Mari, you guys came on the boat from Awashima, right? Was everything okay?

commands.speaker: Kanan
commands.line: Yeah, we made it. The boat is only running this morning though. Can't blame them, considering the weather.

commands.speaker: Ruby
commands.line: I can't believe the Summer Festival got canceled.

commands.speaker: You
commands.line: I had a bad feeling when they announced the expected path of the typhoon had changed.

commands.speaker: Riko
commands.line: It can't be helped when you're up against nature. It's frustrating though.

commands.speaker: Yoshiko
commands.line: Oh, heavenly father... For making not only Yohane, but all the little demons suffer, I shall never forgive you!

commands.speaker: Chika
commands.line: It's not completely canceled though.

commands.speaker: Riko
commands.line: Chika...

commands.speaker: Chika
commands.line: It's a shame the festival was canceled today, but there's still tomorrow!

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: There is another day, but the weather report said it would be bad tomorrow, too.

commands.speaker: Mari
commands.line: What if the typhoon changes its mind and runs away in the middle of the night?

commands.speaker: Dia
commands.line: The typhoon is approaching faster than projected, and they said this morning they haven't decided what to do about tomorrow yet.

commands.speaker: Kanan
commands.line: It's a small chance, but Chika might be right. Not all hope is lost yet.

commands.speaker: You
commands.line: Yeah. Worrying won't help us. We've said that before!

commands.speaker: Mari
commands.line: That's right. Positive thinking brings about miracles no matter what the situation.

commands.speaker: Riko
commands.line: If you think of today as an extra day to prep or practice, it's not even that bad.

commands.speaker: Ruby
commands.line: Then I'd like to practice my lines some more! I've practiced my butt off, but I'm still worried about it.

commands.speaker: Hanamaru
commands.line: Then let's practice, zura! My festival won't be over until I hear Ruby do the tourist info piece, zura.

commands.speaker: Dia
commands.line: We should go over the performance once more, just in case. We might find some improvements to make.

commands.speaker: Kanan
commands.line: We won't be able to do anything that changes the structure of it all, though.

commands.speaker: Mari
commands.line: Will the ingredients for the food be okay? There's stuff that needs to be refrigerated, right?

commands.speaker: You
commands.line: It'll be fine. We're not using any raw meat or fish, and the refrigerated stuff should be fine for a day.

commands.speaker: Yoshiko
commands.line: Hmmm, it's time for Yohane to get serious! I shall call upon the spirits of the sun and dismantle the rain clouds drop by drop!

commands.speaker: Riko
commands.line: And you're going to look up how to do it on your phone?

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: (The typhoon is almost here. Tomorrow might be canceled. Yet everyone's eyes are still gleaming with hope. No one has given up yet.)

commands.speaker: Chika
commands.line: Even if there's only a small chance, we still have to do everything we can.

commands.speaker: Chika
commands.line: I don't want to regret not doing anything, so we can't lose hope until the very end!

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: (That's right. It's not over yet. I have to believe in tomorrow and do everything I can for Aqours until the very end.)

commands.speaker: Riko
commands.line: Chika, are you sure we can stay at your place?

commands.speaker: Chika
commands.line: No problem! I even got the okay from my sisters!

commands.speaker: Mari
commands.line: The Japanese futon provides a mysterious comfort so different from a bed. It fulfills my Japanese mind!

commands.speaker: Hanamaru
commands.line: This is so fun, zura! It's like that school field trip, staying in a ryokan together like this.

commands.speaker: Yoshiko
commands.line: The school trip... You all slept together like this on your trip? It must have been fun.

commands.speaker: Kanan
commands.line: Oh yeah, didn't you get a cold and have to stay home when you had your middle school field trip? Don't worry, you'll be able to go on the next one.

commands.speaker: Ruby
commands.line: It's raining outside. It sounds pretty bad.

commands.speaker: Dia
commands.line: The wind might be peaking right now. I hope it passes overnight.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Um, Chika? Can I hang this up outside the front door?

commands.speaker: Chika
commands.line: Is that...a teru teru bozu doll? There's one, two, three...nine?! Did you make them all?

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Yeah. I made them all in the image of you all. I'm not sure if they'll bring fair weather, but I wanted to do something to ensure tomorrow happens.

commands.speaker: You
commands.line: Hm, this might not be enough.

commands.speaker: Mari
commands.line: Right. Let's take some tissues, wrap them all around, and here! Mari's special teru teru bozu doll! Let's hang this one up, too.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: O-Okay. But why an extra?

commands.speaker: Riko
commands.line: There are more than just nine people hoping for fair weather tomorrow, right?

commands.speaker: Kanan
commands.line: If we don't pray with everyone's power, the true strength of the teru teru bozu dolls might not show!

commands.speaker: Ruby
commands.line: Let's all pray for sun tomorrow.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Right!

commands.speaker: Chika
commands.line: Let's hang them up! Please let everyone have a wonderful time tomorrow!
